comments.body: nit: looks like you can kill the `.toList()` here.
Do we really want to depend on the analyzer?

This package (`flutter_tools`) already has a dependency on the analyzer to support `flutter analyze`, so this is not bringing in a new dependency to the package.

Was bringing in a new dependency your main concern? Or is there something else you're concerned about with regards to using the analyzer for this particular purpose?
@goderbauer I was mostly concerned about bloating the initial download size but if we already depend on it, no big deal.
